title: HP DeskJet 2855e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-home, 3 months of ink included (588S5A)
article_markdown:
# Introduction

The HP DeskJet 2855e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer is designed for home users seeking a reliable and versatile printing solution. With its ability to print, scan, and copy, this compact printer is perfect for everyday tasks such as printing to-do lists, recipes, and financial documents. Notably, it comes with three months of ink included when you activate HP+, making it an attractive option for those who want to save on printing costs while enjoying the convenience of wireless technology.

## Versatile Functionality

The DeskJet 2855e stands out with its all-in-one capabilities, allowing users to print, scan, and copy from a single device. This multifunctionality is particularly beneficial for families or individuals who need to handle various tasks without cluttering their workspace with multiple machines. The printer features a 60-sheet input tray, which is adequate for home use, and offers print speeds of up to 5.5 pages per minute in color and 7.5 pages per minute in black.

## Seamless Wireless Connectivity

One of the key selling points of the DeskJet 2855e is its wireless printing capability. The printer connects effortlessly to your home Wi-Fi network, enabling you to print directly from your smartphone or tablet using the HP Smart app. This app simplifies the printing process, allowing users to manage their printing tasks with ease. The printer is designed to automatically detect and resolve connection issues, ensuring a hassle-free experience.

## User-Friendly Design

The compact design of the DeskJet 2855e makes it an excellent fit for any home office or workspace. Its intuitive control panel, complete with an icon LCD, allows users to navigate through basic functions easily. The setup process is straightforward, with step-by-step instructions provided through the HP Smart app, making it accessible even for those who may not be tech-savvy.

## Customer Experiences

Customer reviews highlight a mix of positive and negative experiences with the HP DeskJet 2855e. Many users appreciate the ease of setup and the printer's ability to connect seamlessly to various devices. One satisfied customer noted that they were able to set up the printer in under ten minutes, contrasting their experience with a previous printer that was much more complicated to connect.

Print quality has also received praise, with users reporting vibrant colors and clear text. The whisper-quiet operation during printing and scanning has been a pleasant surprise for many, making it suitable for home environments where noise levels matter.

However, some users have expressed frustration with connectivity issues, particularly with the printer going offline unexpectedly. Others have raised concerns about the reliance on the HP+ subscription for ink, feeling that it limits their control over the printer's functionality. While some found the Instant Ink subscription beneficial, others felt it complicated their printing experience.

## Conclusion

The HP DeskJet 2855e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer offers a compelling combination of functionality, ease of use, and compact design, making it a solid choice for home users. Its wireless capabilities and user-friendly app enhance the printing experience, while the included three months of ink provides an attractive incentive for new buyers. However, potential customers should consider the mixed reviews regarding connectivity and the subscription model for ink. Overall, if you're looking for a reliable and versatile printer for occasional home use, the DeskJet 2855e is worth considering.
pros: Easy setup process with HP Smart app, allowing quick connection to Wi-Fi.
Compact design suitable for home use, fitting well in small spaces.
Includes 3 months of Instant Ink subscription, providing convenience and cost savings.
Whisper-quiet operation during printing and scanning.
Good print quality with vibrant colors for documents and photos.
cons: Reliability issues with Wi-Fi connectivity, often requiring restarts.
Subscription model for ink can be frustrating, limiting printer use if payments fail.
Limited paper capacity in the input tray, requiring frequent refills.
Print speed is slower than advertised, especially for multiple pages.
Some users report difficulties with printer going offline unexpectedly.
